Checks if path is root folder path, which can be an empty string, null, or the actual root path.

bool

Normalize(string, bool)

Normalizes path. Normalisation makes sure that:

  • When path is null or empty returns root path '/'
  • path separators are trimmed from both ends
public static string Normalize(string path, bool removeTrailingSlash = false)

Returns

string

Split(string)

Splits path in parts. Leading and trailing path separators are totally ignored. Note that it returns null if input path is null. Parent folder signatures are returned as a part of split, they are not removed. If you want to get an absolute normalized path use Normalize(string, bool)

public static string[] Split(string path)

Parameters

path string

Returns

string[]
